Sentencas: Double perovskites with composition Sr2BM0O(6 - delta) (B = Mg, Ni and Co) and Sr2Fe1.5Mo0.5O6 - delta have been proposed as potential anode material for direct hydrocarbon oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Chemical stability and compatibility of double perovskite anode materials for SOFCs

Sentencas: However, the phase stability under different atmospheres (H-2 and CO2) and the chemical compatibility with different electrolytes of most of these materials have not been previously studied.
Titulo: Chemical stability and compatibility of double perovskite anode materials for SOFCs

Sentencas: The chemical compatibility studies carried out by X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) revealed high reactivity between these electrodes and zirconia based electrolytes, Zr0.84Y0.16O2 - delta, at temperatures as low as 800 C with the formation of SrMoO4 and SrZrO3 as main reaction products; however, lower chemical reactivity was found with Ce0.8Gd0.2O2 - delta.
Titulo: Chemical stability and compatibility of double perovskite anode materials for SOFCs

Sentencas: Sr2CoMoO6 - delta and Sr2NiMoO6 (- delta) phases resulted to be unstable under reducing atmosphere above 800 C, decomposing partially into Sr3MoO6 and Co/Ni metals respectively.
Titulo: Chemical stability and compatibility of double perovskite anode materials for SOFCs

Sentencas: These two materials also exhibited low resistance to carbonation in the intermediate temperature range 600-800 degrees
Titulo: Chemical stability and compatibility of double perovskite anode materials for SOFCs

Sentencas: C. Nevertheless, Sr2Fe15Mo0.5O6 (- delta) is stable under H2 and pure CO2 atmospheres.
Titulo: Chemical stability and compatibility of double perovskite anode materials for SOFCs

Sentencas: Furthermore, area specific resistances of these anode materials in symmetrical cells were determined in order to compare their electrochemical efficiency.
Titulo: Chemical stability and compatibility of double perovskite anode materials for SOFCs
